title: Drugs
content:
No, not whether they should be legalized, I'm talkin 'bout the already legal ones; namely, medicines.

Over the last two decades the definition of 'ilness' has been widened, and we're even hoping for 'superhealth'; trying to be healthier than whats normal. To this end we now consume record numbers of antidepressants, sleeping pills, weightloss tablets, vitamins, Statins and supplements, many of which have no or negligible benefit, and may even cause harm. The drug companies themselves have adopted a 'sell to everyone' policy, and are now providing considerible 'incentive' and 'training' to medical practitiors to encourage 'proper perscription and use of products' So the question is; 'do you think we need to find some way of curbing our 'medicine' intake?'A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

title: Re: Drugs
content:
I think people do tend to medicate too readily. Some people really do need them -- pain killers after surgery, antihistamines for the severely allergic, and so on -- but taking whatever medication you think might help every time you get mildly ill is overkill, and some people do that. I'm lucky enough not to require medication for anything serious, so I never take any medicine at all.________________

Drugs can be dangerous, when people take the wrong ones at the wrong moments. And a mix of pills can even become more dangerous.____________
